Responsibilities: Worked on an Alexa Skills project named 'Intelligent Personal Assistant'.
Contributed to the backend development for the 'Alexa Tree' project.
Leveraged Python libraries for data collection, preprocessing, and visualization tasks.
Conducted comprehensive data analysis to extract insights from datasets.

Details: Developed a binary classification model to detect fraudulent credit card transactions using a dataset of 284,807 transactions with 30 features.

Implemented data preprocessing, addressed class imbalance with undersampling and oversampling, and trained three classifiers: Logistic Regression, Decision Tree Classifier, and Random Forest Classifier.
Assessed models using accuracy, precision, recall, and F1 score.
Developed and enhanced Alexa skill using abstracted Python codes.
Integrated additional functionalities through APIs from Google Cloud Console.

Projects.Project Name: Exploratory Data Analysis on Global Terrorism
Details: Conducted Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA) on the comprehensive Global Terrorism Dataset, comprising over 7000+ worldwide incidents.
Ensured data quality through data cleaning, null imputation and outlier detection.
Utilized visualizations to uncover patterns and trends in global terrorism data.
Employed libraries such as pandas, matplotlib, and seaborn for data analysis and visualization.
